page.title: 05Religion in Haverfordwest
page.content: There are three churches; St.Mary's in the centre of town,was built largely during the Gothic period. It has a flat wooden ceiling covering the nave. St. Martin's is found near the castle and was the first to be built in the town. It has a stone spire. St. Thomas' sits on the summit of a hill, in a large churchyard. Chapels are many; Albany Congregational,1638; Bethesda Baptist,1740 reputed to be one of the finest in Wales; Moravian Church,1773, on St.Thomas' Green; Methodist,1769, enlarged many times; Tabernacle Congregational,1774; Ebenezer Presbyterian Church 1817; Hill Park Baptist,1855, and the Roman Catholic Church in Dew Street, Built in 1872 and both renovated and beautified in the 1950's.
